docs.lead_paragraph: For all the changes the Senate health care bill portends, at least one thing should hold constant: those ubiquitous ''ask your doctor'' television advertisements for prescription drugs. Lobbyists turned back efforts in both the Senate and the House to end the business-tax deductions that drug makers can take for advertising.
docs.abstract: Drug industry lobbyists turned back efforts in health care overhaul to end business-tax deductions that drug makers can take for advertisements; United States is one of only two countries that allow direct-to-consumer advertising of prescription drugs; supporters say commercials educate patients and save lives, while critics say they help drive up health care costs by encouraging consumers to take more expensive and sometimes less effective drugs, in some cases for invented diseases (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: On the morning before Christmas, the Senate convened to vote on health care overhaul, passing the measure by a party-line vote of 60-39.

headline.main: Voting for Health Overhaul on Christmas Eve

docs.snippet: On the morning before Christmas, the Senate convened to vote on health care overhaul, passing the measure by a party-line vote of 60-39.

docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama, speaking at the White House before leaving to celebrate Christmas in Hawaii, praised the Senate for approving major health care legislation.

headline.main: Obama Praises Senate Bill, Heads for Hawaii

docs.lead_paragraph: It may have seemed dicey at times, but Senate Majority Leader Harry Reid has met his self-imposed Christmas deadline for approving health care legislation -- with more than a few hours to spare.

headline.main: The Early Word: Senate Says Aye

docs.abstract: The Senate approves its health care legislation in a rare Christmas Eve vote.

docs.lead_paragraph: Good morning on this Christmas Eve.
docs.abstract: This is the last DealBook newsletter for 2009 as we take a holiday break until we return after the New Year.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate voted 60-39 Thursday to reinvent the nation's health care system, passing a bill to guarantee access to health insurance for tens of millions of Americans and to rein in health costs as proposed by President Obama. Read the full story, and find updates about the vote throughout the day on the Prescriptions blog.

docs.abstract: The Senate, voting early on Christmas Eve, approved landmark legislation to overhaul the nation's health care system.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Senate’s final vote marks the culmination of more than a generation of polarization of the political system.
